intro: Dalechampia variabilis, commonly known as the variable dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swampy areas. Dalechampia variabilis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can be cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden beds.
